page.title: 06Housing in Bexley Village
page.content: Housing in Bexley show part of it's History. There are houses which were built in the Victorian age and even some from before that. Some of the victorian houses are large and are either detached or semi-detached. Some have four floors which include a cellar and attic where maids would sleep. Other victorian houses were not for the rich people but for the workers. These are terraced. There are Alms houses in Bexley which date from 1755 and which are being renovated. There are many other houses which were built either side of the 2nd World War. These are usually semi-detached houses or bungalows. Recently some old large houses have been demolished and flats or link houses built on the land. Much more modern houses, with modern facilities can also be found.
